channel.title: The day the music died
channel.description:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y0Y_XRiJsCI&feature=related
"When asked what "American Pie" meant, McLean replied, "It means I never have to work again." Later, he more seriously stated, "You will find many interpretations of my lyrics but none of them by me... sorry to leave you all on your own like this but long ago I realized that songwriters should make their statements and move on, maintaining a dignified silence."
On February 3, 1959, a small-plane crash near Clear Lake, Iowa, killed three American rock and roll musicians: Buddy Holly, Ritchie Valens, and J. P. "The Big Bopper" Richardson, as well as the pilot, Roger Peterson.The day was later called The Day the Music Died by Don McLean, in his song "American Pie".
Without looking up the what the song meanings listen to the song and try to interpret what the song means.

item.title: The day the music died
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

Part biography, part auto-biography. Part of Don McLean’s perspective when he find out that Buddy Holly died, as well as giving the perspective of Buddy Holly saying “Bye Bye…”.

Read full topic

item.title: The day the music died
item.dc:creator: @Not_X_A_Alex Not X A Alex
item.description:
@Not_X_A_Alex wrote:

I’ve listened to this since I was a wee-boy. Great song.

Read full topic
